cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north this morning, then turning north-northeast tonight toward the southwest Louisiana coast while skirting the upper Texas coast east of Port Arthur

weather_observation.watch_coast: High Island, TX to Morgan City, LA (hurricane); west of High Island to Sargent, TX (tropical-storm); extensive storm-surge warnings High Island, TX to Pearl River, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: High Island, Texas to Morgan City, Louisiana
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast (High Island–Sabine Pass) and southwest Louisiana coast (Holly Beach–Cameron)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely; a 19 % chance exists for 50-kt (58 mph) sustained winds and isolated hurricane-force gusts can’t be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible along High Island-Sabine Pass coast and 1–3 ft into Sabine Lake and surrounding bays.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated totals up to 10 inches possible, leading to flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, a few tornadoes possible in rainbands Friday–Friday night, brief visibility drops and lightning affecting cargo operations.
